title: Is using big vocabulary words in English good in writing anything? - Quora
tags: English Word Definitions, Terminology, and Jargon

response.answer_text: The questions has already been answered in great details in various previous questions. I cannot redirect the question as none of them answers the question exactly. So, I will tell the steps of question-answers one should read to get to the answer of this question.Start reading the answers for Why do people use big words?Now, another question would spring up in your mind Do people try to act smart by using unnecessarily large words and complex sentences to answer a simple question?This might be of interest to you too What's the purpose of long words which have short, simple equivalents?And finally the most interesting part Does a broader vocabulary allow you to think faster? All in all the conclusions are as follows: Grandiloquence is great if you could carry it off.A broader vocabulary is always a better tool in communication.Having a broader vocabulary in your mother tongue also is a huge benefit.A word cannot be replaced by its synonyms under all situations.Some people try to show-off.A broader vocabulary might help you to think faster.

It depends. I read lot of answers here, most of them are "NO" suggestive. But basics of any language is to express one-self , lucid or complex comes later.  So when you think of a sentence in mind saying "It was not a good film at all. " and your intuition okays it to write as it as , well all the best.  But most of the times there comes a filter between thought and putting it in writing. One thinks "How do I make this sentence better ?" and the one who has keeps on asking himself this question constantly to himself ends up saying "The movie was nothing but quantum entanglement of charred carbohydrate particles of existential tomfoolery , inane drudgery , unadulterated nonsense and audacious lunacy with a smear of processed bovine essence soaked in tears of metaphysical torment." So is "Is using big vocabulary words in English good in writing anything? . No. Using big words in English is good for writing every single thing.

The write up should be easy to read and interpret. If you make use of lexicon wisely, you may make the text more decorative and vivid however at the other end if reader is not familier with those words then he has to sit with a dictionary. So it completely depends whether you are writing for educational purpose (in text books/for kids) or for help on some matter to laymen (user manuals etc).
The only thing is that whatever you write should be clear to you and the readers. Instead of using big vocabulary word inappropriately it is always better to use a correct short word.
